intro: Erythrocephalum niassae, commonly known as the Niassa thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its erect, spiny stems and purple to pinkish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. Erythrocephalum niassae is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
